authors.name: Paula  Aulicino
authors.affiliation: Hospital de Pediatria "Prof. Dr. Juan P. Garrahan"

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1fcqa","text":"The protocol allows amplification and NGS sequencing of a PR-RT HIV-1 sequence using tagmentation strategy and Illumina MiSeq equipment, followed by analysis of drug-resistance associated mutations by HyDRA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: HIV type-1 genotypic resistance profiles in vertically infected patients from Argentina reveal an association between K103N+L100I and L74V mutations.
references.authors: Aulicino PC, Rocco CA, Mecikovsky D, Bologna R, Mangano A, Sen L

references.title: A MiSeq-HyDRA platform for enhanced HIV drug resistance genotyping and surveillance.
references.authors: Taylor T, Lee ER, Nykoluk M, Enns E, Liang B, Capina R, Gauthier MK, Domselaar GV, Sandstrom P, Brooks J, Ji H

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb3ki","text":"Prepare the sample in BSL2 laboratory. This protocol can be used to amplify and sequence HIV-1 from plasma or culture supernatants, as well as from cell-associated HIV-1. In the latter, skip the step of reverse transcription and go straight to PCR amplification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jqbu","text":"Perform reverse transcription of HIV-1 and PCR amplification of PR-RT 1168bp fragment using primers and conditions published in Aulicino et al, Antivir Ther 2010;15(4):641-50. PCR amplifications are performed in 25-cycle reactions to avoid introducing artificial mutations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18pv7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7kacs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Aulicino PC, Rocco CA, Mecikovsky D, Bologna R, Mangano A, Sen L","can_edit":1,"date":"1262304000","doi":"https://doi.org/10.3851/IMP1571","guid":"6379ADA0575811EC821CF7E279780D25","id":1456,"journal":"Antiviral therapy","protocol_id":"0","title":"HIV type-1 genotypic resistance profiles in vertically infected patients from Argentina reveal an association between K103N+L100I and L74V mutations."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1d9cl","text":"Check second PCR products with agarose gel electrophoresis (1%). A single 1168bp band should be visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98rc","text":"Perform purification of the PCR product with magnetic beads (Agencourt AMPure XP kit, Beckman Coulter, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5hkn","text":"Perform tagmentation and indexation with Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA), following manufacturer´s instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cku79","text":"Check electrophoresis tagmentation patterns with QIAxel or another similar equipment. If none is available, a polyacrylamide gel can be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"t5fv","text":"Quantify DNA using the fluorometric Qubit dsDNA high-sensitivity (HS) assay (Qubit 1X dsDNA HS Assay Kit, ThermoFisher Scientific, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"espa6","text":"Calculate PCR samples concentration and volume to normalize all samples to 2nM, using PCR water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bppvo","text":"Pool all samples using 5ul of each 2nM dilution of each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"firvp","text":"Prepare PhiX at 12.5 pM. Dilute the library to 8 picomolar in HT1 buffer, and add 20% of PhiX. The purpose of PhiX is to add diversity to the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"as5c8","text":"pNL4-3 HIV-1 was used as control. Using BWA, align fastq reads belonging to the control sample to the reference pNL4-3 HIV-1 genome (GenBank Accession Number AF324493). Calculate the average number of mismatches/ total bases. Error Rate should not exceed 0,5%. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n3ls","text":"HyDRA (https://hydra.canada.ca/pages/home?lang=en-CA) is an annotated reference-based bioinformatics pipeline scripted in Perl, which analyses next generation sequencing (NGS) data for genotyping HIV-1 drug resistance (HIVDR) mutations. It utilizes an annotated HXB2 sequence (GenBank Accession number: K03455) for reference mapping by Bowtie2 2 , and stringent data quality assurance and variant calling criteria to identify HIVDR associated mutations based on the Stanford HIV Drug Resistance Database (http://hivdb.stanford.edu/) and 2009 WHO list for Surveillance of Transmitted HIVDR. All HIVDR mutations found in the pol genes; protease (PR), reverse transcriptase (RT), and integrase (IN), are reported according to classifications outlined in the Stanford Surveillance Drug Resistance Mutation list .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":45}],"data":{}},{"key":"4tfjv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5l4qc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CD08D111575D11EC91690A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://hydra.canada.ca/pages/home?lang=en-CA"}},"1":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Taylor T, Lee ER, Nykoluk M, Enns E, Liang B, Capina R, Gauthier MK, Domselaar GV, Sandstrom P, Brooks J, Ji H","can_edit":1,"date":"1560988800","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-019-45328-3","guid":"9D48ED20575D11EC821CF7E279780D25","id":1457,"journal":"Scientific reports","protocol_id":"0","title":"A MiSeq-HyDRA platform for enhanced HIV drug resistance genotyping and surveillance."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ad05r","text":"Submit sequences to HyDRA. The following Advanced options for Nextera seqs can be used to inform amino acids in 1% frequency or higher, with a minimum read depth of 1000 x:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gjqb","text":"Consensus percent: 20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0jsk","text":"Target coverage: -1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a6hr","text":"Length cutoff: 100","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ne8v","text":"Score cutoff: 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hf2i","text":"Error rate: include error rate calculated with the control (e.g. 0.005)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"casi0","text":"Minimum variant quality: 20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gc8e","text":"Minimum read depth: 1000","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ace81","text":"Minimum allele count: 7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blh96","text":"Minimum amino acid frequency: 0.01 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Nextera XT protocol for MiSeq HIVPR-RT sequencing
